Detailed Description

Class FaceIndex implements a simple n-dimensional integer vector for face centered variables. Face indices contain an integer index location in AMR index space along with the designated face axis (X=0, Y=1, or Z=2). See the face box geometry class for more information about the mapping between the AMR index space and the face indices.

See also:
hier::Index

pdat::FaceData

pdat::FaceGeometry

pdat::FaceIterator

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::FaceIndex ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim  )  [explicit]

The default constructor for a face index creates an uninitialized index.

SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::FaceIndex ( const hier::Index &  rhs,
const int  axis,
const int  face 
)

Construct a face index from a regular index, axis, and face. The axis can be one of FaceIndex::X (0), FaceIndex::Y (1), or FaceIndex::Z (2). The face argument can be one of the constants FaceIndex::Lower (0) or FaceIndex::Upper (1).

SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::FaceIndex ( const FaceIndex &  rhs  ) 

The copy constructor creates a face index equal to the argument.

SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::~FaceIndex (  ) 

The face index destructor does nothing interesting.

hier::Index SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::toCell ( const int  face  )  const

Convert the face index into the index on the left hand face (argument face == 0) or the right hand face (argument face == 1).

bool SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::operator== ( const FaceIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two face index objects are equal. All components and the corresponding face axes must be the same for equality.

Precondition:
getDim() == rhs.getDim()

bool SAMRAI::pdat::FaceIndex::operator!= ( const FaceIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two face index objects are not equal. Any of the components or axes may be different for inequality.

Precondition:
getDim() == rhs.getDim()
